Enable force from HSUB0 DATA1 pad configuration MuxMode when CARKITEN is generated:0: HSUB0 DATA1 pad MuxMode is driven by HSUB0 DATA1 pad configuration register.1: HSUB0 DATA1 pad MuxMode is forced to 0x2 when CARKITEN signal is active.

Enable force from HSUB0 DATA0 pad configuration MuxMode when CARKITEN is generated0 : HSUB0 DATA0 pad MuxMode is driven by HSUB0 NXT pad configuration register1 : HSUB0 DATA0 pad MuxMode is forced to 0x2 when CARKITEN signal is active.

Format used in the field name below is : (programmable_group_name)_(configurable_pin on IO cell)Far end load setting.Transmission Line (TL) characteristic impedance is 50 Ohm, TL capacitance =1pF / cm : 0x0: Far end load = [1pF-10pF] / TL length=[1cm-6cm] 0x1: Far end load = [10pF-16pF] / TL length=[1cm-6cm]

Slew rate control bits.Format used in the field name below is: (programmable_group_name)_(configurable_pin on IO cell) See for the allowed SC vs LB bit field combinations

Effective TL length and farend capacitive load controls. This bit allows control of programmable drive/slew control on IO cell. Format used in the field name below is: (programmable_group_name)_(configurable_pin on IO cell)See for the allowed SC vs LB bit field combinations

Format used in the field name below is : (programmable_group_name)_(configurable_pin on IO cell)Far end load setting.Transmission Line (TL) characteristic impedance is 50 Ohm, TL capacitance =1pF / cm: 0x0: Far end load = [1pF-10pF] / TL length=[1cm-6cm] 0x1: Far end load = [10pF-16pF] / TL length=[1cm-6cm]

The bits select a proper resistor value for the I2C1 pullups for a given load range at FS / HS modes.Format used in the field name below is: (programmable_group_name)_(configurable_pin on IO cell) FS mode :0b00: 4,5K Ohms / 5-15pF cap.load0b01: 2,1K Ohms /15-50pF cap.load0b10: 860 Ohms / 50-150pF cap.load0b11: Reserved HS mode :0b00: 1,66K Ohms / 5-12pF cap.load0b01: 920 Ohms / 12-25pF cap.load0b10: 500 Ohms/ 25-50pF cap.load0b11: 300 Ohms/ 50-80pF cap.load See for example [LB1:LB0] bit field vs PRG_I2C1_PULLUPRESX bit combinations.

The bits select a proper resistor value for the I2C2 pull-ups for a given load range at FS / HS modes.Format used in the field name below is : (programmable_group_name)_(configurable_pin on IO cell) FS mode :0b00: 4,5K Ohms / 5-15pF cap.load0b01: 2,1K Ohms /15-50pF cap.load0b10: 860 Ohms / 50-150pF cap.load0b11: Reserved HS mode :0b00: 1,66K Ohms / 5-12pF cap.load0b01: 920 Ohms / 12-25pF cap.load0b10: 500 Ohms/ 25-50pF cap.load0b11: 300 Ohms/ 50-80pF cap.load See for example [LB1:LB0] bit field vs PRG_I2C2_PULLUPRESX bit combinations.

The bits select a proper resistor value for the I2C3 pull-ups for a given load range at FS / HS modes.Format used in the field name below is : (programmable_group_name)_(configurable_pin on IO cell) FS mode :0b00: 4,5K Ohms / 5-15pF cap.load0b01: 2,1K Ohms /15-50pF cap.load0b10: 860 Ohms / 50-150pF cap.load0b11: Reserved HS mode :0b00: 1,66K Ohms / 5-12pF cap.load0b01: 920 Ohms / 12-25pF cap.load0b10: 500 Ohms/ 25-50pF cap.load0b11: 300 Ohms/ 50-80pF cap.load See for example [LB1:LB0] bit field vs PRG_I2C3_PULLUPRESX bit combinations.

Format used in the field name below is : (programmable_group_name)_(configurable_pin on IO cell)I2C3 pad group control for internal pull-up resistors enable:0x0 : Enables internal pull-ups for the I2C3 pad group0x1: Disables internal pull-ups for the I2C3 pad group

Format used in the field name below is : (programmable_group_name)_(configurable_pin on IO cell)Far end load setting.Transmission Line (TL) characteristic impedance is 50 Ohm, TL capacitance =1pF / cm: 0x0: Far end load = [1pF-10pF] / TL length=[1cm-6cm] 0x1: Far end load = [10pF-16pF] / TL length=[1cm-6cm]

Effective TL length and farend capacitive load controls. This bit allows control of programmable drive/slew control on IO cell. Format used in the field name below is: (programmable_group_name)_(configurable_pin on IO cell)See for the allowed SC vs LB bit field combinations !
Slew rate control bits.Format used in the field name below is : (programmable_group_name)_(configurable_pin on IO cell) See for the allowed SC vs LB bitfield combinations !

register.description: Allows locking of the modem isolation registers in the SCM until the next battery removal.

bitfield.description: Read returns reset value.
Allows locking of the modem isolation registers in the SCM until the next battery removal.
Select if CMDWT or OCMRAM is accessible by the Modem
Configuration of the modem stack memory size
Configuration of the SMS modem memory
Configuration of the GPMC modem shared section size
Configuration of the GPMC modem reserved section size
Configuration of the GPMC base address of the modem reserved section. This base address is configurable in 1Mbyte step.

register.description: This register controls the settings for PBIAS LITE MMC/SD/SDIO1 pins

bitfield.description: Reserved for future use.
Status indicating if PBIAS1 cell is supplied by 1.8 or 3.0 SIM_VDDS 1 =&gt; SIM_VDDS = 3.0 V 0 =&gt; SIM_VDDS = 1.8 V
Reserved for future use

Status indicating if the software-programmed VMODE level matches the SUPPLY_HI output signal0b0 =&gt; VMODE Level same or VMODE level not considered.0b1 =&gt; indicates VMODE_LEVEL not same as SUPPLY_HI_OUT
Input signal referenced to VDD2. Software must keep this signal low whenever SIM_VDDS is ramping up. 1 =&gt; SIM_VDDS stable 0 =&gt; SIM_VDDS is ramping up
SIM_VDDS voltage level information:1 =&gt; SIM_VDDS = 3.0 V 0 =&gt; SIM_VDDS = 1.8 V
Status indicating if PBIAS0 is supplied by 1.8 V or 3.0 V SDMMC1_VDDS0b0 => PBIAS0 is supplied by SDMMC1_VDDS = 1.8 V . 0b1 => PBIAS0 is supplied by SDMMC1_VDDS = 3.0 V .
Read returns reset value.

Status indicating if the software programmed VMODE level matches the SUPPLY_HI output signal0b0 => VMODE level same or VMODE level not considered . 0b1 => Indicates VMODE_LEVEL not same as SUPPLY_HI_OUT .
Input Signal Referenced to VDD2. Software has to keep this bit at 0b0 when SDMMC1_VDDS is ramping up0b0 => SDMMC1_VDDS ramping up . 0b1 => SDMMC1_VDDS stable .
SDMMC1_VDDS voltage level information control from software0b0 => SDMMC1_VDDS = 1.8 V . 0b1 => SDMMC1_VDDS = 3.0 V .
Read returns reset value.
VDD level digital inputs. When high the ADC is in continuous conversion mode0 : ADC Single Conversion Mode;1 : ADC Continuous Conversion Mode
ADC Start of Conversion. A transition to high starts a new ADC conversion cycle
ADC End of Conversion. Active low, when CTRL_ TEMP[7:0] is valid
Temperature data from the ADC. Valid if EOCZ is low
Read returns reset value

Reserved: Keep at reset value.
Optional control used only for dual-channel configuration. It should be low by default (single-channel configuration).

bitenum.description: (default) Single channel
Dual channel configuration

bitfield.description: Optional control used only for dual-channel configuration. It should be low by default (single-channel configuration).

bitenum.description: (default) Module configured as Luma video channel (dual-channel configuration) or Composite video channel (single-channel configuration).
Module configured as Chroma video channel (dual-channel configuration).

bitfield.description: Optional control for lower output swing. It should be low by default (high output swing).

bitenum.description: (default) High full-scale output swing
Low full-scale output swing.

bitfield.description: Optional control for internal current reference. It should be low by default (external current reference).

bitenum.description: (default) External current reference (external resistor connected to rset)
Internal current reference. In this case, clkres clock is required to generate the current reference based on an internal switched-cap resistor.

bitfield.description: Reserved: Keep at reset value.
Reserved: Keep at reset value.
Optional control used only for dual-channel configuration. It should be low by default (single-channel configuration).

bitenum.description: (default) Single channel
Dual channel configuration

bitfield.description: Optional control used only for dual-channel configuration. It should be low by default (single-channel configuration).

bitenum.description: (default) Module configured as Luma video channel (dual-channel configuration) or Composite video channel (single-channel configuration).
Module configured as Chroma video channel (dual-channel configuration).

bitfield.description: Optional control for lower output swing. It should be low by default (high output swing).

bitenum.description: (default) High full-scale output swing
Low full-scale output swing.

bitfield.description: Optional control for internal current reference. It should be low by default (external current reference).

bitenum.description: (default) External current reference (external resistor connected to rset)
Internal current reference. In this case, clkres clock is required to generate the current reference based on an internal switched-cap resistor.

bitfield.description: Reserved: Keep at reset value.

register.description: Register to control the mode and multiplexing of the two camera complex IOs (CSIPHY2 and CSIPHY1 )

bitfield.description: Reserved field
Selects the CAMERA PHY that will feed the receiver B on ISP2P 0 : CAMERA1_PHY data is sent to ISP2P receiver B 1 : CAMERA2_PHY data is sent to ISP2P receiver B

Sets the mode of CSIPHY100: D-PHY mode01: CCP2 mode configured for data/strobe transmission10: CCP2 mode configured for data/clock transmission11: GPI modeNot a dynamic signal. Should be changed only when the CSIPHY1 is in OFF power state

Sets the mode of CSIPHY200: D-PHY mode01: CCP2 mode configured for data/strobe transmission10: CCP2 mode configured for data/clock transmission11: GPI modeNot a dynamic signal. Should be changed only when the CSIPHY2 is in OFF power state
Revision number
Hawkeye number
Manufacturer identity (TI)
Always set to 1
